title: Article Stealth Edited After Revealing Anita Sarkeesian's $20,000 Speaking Fee
title_page: Article Stealth Edited After Revealing Anita Sarkeesian's $20,000 Speaking Fee | Breitbart
text:
Feminist Frequency spokesperson Anita Sarkeesian’s public speaking fee has been revealed to be at $20,000, or $5,000 for students on a budget.
The popular feminist icon raised over $158,000 in her Kickstarter campaign back in 2012 but still charges $20,000 per speech according to the Corsair Online.
“Coming to SMC may be a nostalgia trip for Sarkeesian, as Interim Associated Dean Of Student Life Dr. Nancy Grass confirmed that she is a SMC Alumna who used to be a research assistant for Grass in the early 2000’s. As a result of this relationship, Sarkeesian waived the majority of her standard $20,000 speaking fee, allowing the Associated Students (AS) to schedule her appearance for $5,000 instead,” wrote Adam R. Thomas in an article which has since been scrubbed of the $20,000 figure.
It is unknown as to why Thomas, who acts as the news editor for the Corsair Online, decided to later omit this fact, but after the figure was shared across social media, financially secretive Sarkeesian could not have been too impressed.
It looks like The Ministry of Truth got to the article revealing Anita Sarkeesian's speaking fees. #GamerGate pic.twitter.com/cX1GgOeGuM — Captain Privilege (@Capt_Privilege) February 24, 2016
The news comes after Black Lives Matter activist Shaun King tried to charge an undercover reporter $7,500 for a speech, not including travel and accommodation in November. The same agency quoted $50,000 for Atlantic journalist Ta-Nehisi Coates, but would not give a fee quote for Black Lives Matter activist DeRay Mckesson, who was also represented by the agency.
Breitbart Tech editor Milo Yiannopoulos is currently undergoing his “Dangerous Faggot “public speaking tour in the US, UK, and Mexico, where he is attending a number of student events and university campuses for free.
